DESCRIPTION:
Bevi is on a mission to disrupt the beverage supply chain and replace single-use water bottles with smart water machines. Thousands of companies use Bevi to sustainably provide their employees with pure, sparkling, and flavored water at work. As the market leader in IoT-enabled beverage machines, we’ve raised over $160M in venture capital and we have grown tremendously each year since launch. In addition to maintaining hypergrowth with our current product line, Bevi is heavily investing in new product development.

Bevi is seeking a highly motivated and proactive Billing & Revenue Analyst to manage the day-to-day activities of the accounts receivable function. This is a great opportunity for an individual with an accounting, finance, or business degree. The ideal candidate will have strong analytical and communication skills and possess the ability to juggle competing priorities. The Billing & Revenue Analyst will report to the Senior Manager of Revenue and Billing and will be an integral and critical member of our Finance team and will collaborate cross-functionally with members of Sales, Customer Support, Supply Chain and Operations.

This position will require 2 days per week in the office in Charlestown, MA.

What you will do

  • Ensure customers and distributors are billed on time and with full accuracy
  • Manage the daily inflow of Billing department support tickets
  • Respond to customer billing inquiries via Zendesk (our Customer Support platform), email, and phone
  • Monitor Accounts Receivable and Aging reports, and collect on overdue
    accounts
  • Apply customer payments to invoices
  • Complete weekly/monthly/ad hoc reporting
  • Assist with month end close tasks, such as revenue analysis, contract analysis, monthly GL account reconciliation, and AR aging analysis
  • Operate as an individual contributor within the Finance team, and collaborate cross-functionally with other departments and teams within Bevi
  • Assist with year-end Financial Audit

How you will grow

  • Engage with a talented Finance team drawn from diverse industries
  • Learn financial processes and best practices in a high-paced environment
  • Hone skills on industry-wide financial platforms and systems (Netsuite ERP, Salesforce CRM, Zen Desk Customer Support)
  • Deploy your energy and expertise to further the company's mission of sustainability, wellness, and positive personal and environmental change.
NAME: Billing & Revenue Analyst
TAGS: Food, Hardware, Internet Services, Sustainability, 201 - 1000, Series C+,

DESCRIPTION:
Bubble makes it easier for everyone to build software. From early-stage founders building their very first product, to engineers working on large teams and wanting to build more efficiently, Bubble's drag and drop functionality and visual design language makes building full-stack applications faster and easier than ever before. As the only full-stack, no-code platform on the market with over 2 million users in over 100 countries, Bubble is making software development more accessible and breaking down the barriers to entrepreneurship across the globe.

About the team:

We’re seeking a Digital Designer to join our growing Brand Studio at Bubble. This passionate team brings Bubble’s personality and values to life and gives shape to how Bubble shows up in the world consistently through every brand touch point. This role will support our mission of delivering creative web and digital experiences that meet our users where they are — while maintaining a focus on accessibility, user experience, research, and growth. Our team is looking to make big swings in the next year, and this role will be key in evolving our marketing surfaces in ways that support our engaged audience of designers, developers, and founders.

About the role:

As a Digital Designer, you’ll work at the intersection of brand, UX, and growth. You’ll work closely with our Creative Lead and collaborators on our Design team to create beautiful interactive experiences across all of Bubble’s marketing sites, evolve our design system, and establish UX best practices.

What you'll do at Bubble:

  • Own and drive best-in-class UX and design across our marketing websites, from concept through to prototype and production, while upholding high standards for design and product quality
  • Contribute to overall strategy and decision-making about brand direction, using data and research to inform decisions
  • Help deliver and refine clear storytelling around design needs and opportunities
  • Establish best practices for UX across all customer journeys and flows
  • Work cross-functionally with Brand Studio, Product, PMM, Growth, and Research peers to balance user needs with business and performance goals
  • Work with the wider marketing team to propose, design, and run tests to improve conversion and information architecture of the site
  • Collaborate with Design team and cross-functional teams to drive our design system forward
  • Actively contribute to the evolution of the Bubble brand by exploring novel solutions that support our brand and marketing goals
  • Collaborate with marketing, product design, and growth teams to concept digital experiences, campaigns, and launch announcements that support new products and features

We’d love to hear from you if you have:

  • 5+ years of experience working as a web designer
  • Experience in and enthusiasm for the intersection between brand, UX, and growth
  • A strong portfolio showcasing brand experience across digital surfaces
  • Expertise in UX patterns, a11y best practices, interaction design, and typography
  • Strong skills around communication, critical thinking, problem solving, and storytelling
  • Experience building design systems in Figma
  • Experience with working with research to run experiments and harness data to drive decision-making
  • The ability to work independently to explore concepts from beginning to end, while seeking healthy feedback loops with your ideas
  • Comfortable in your soft skills: collaborating cross-functionally, listening, negotiating, and decision-making
  • Nice to haves: familiarity with Bubble, interest in AI tools, and animation

If this sounds like you, apply! If you don’t meet all of the qualifications but think you could be a match, we’d still love the chance to review your application.

We offer competitive compensation aligned to tier one markets, such as New York City, San Francisco, and Seattle. Our estimated salary for this role at Bubble ranges from $102,000 to $120,000. Actual pay is determined by multiple factors such as skills, qualifications, experience and market demand.

At Bubble, we encourage people from all ages, abilities, and experiences to apply. Bubble does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, ancestry, religion, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital or family status, disability, gender, gender identity or expression, pregnancy or caregiver status, veteran status, or any other legally protected status.

For this role, Bubble is currently only considering candidates who are authorized to work in the US and are within commuting distance of our office in New York City. We will provide relocation assistance to those who are interested in moving to the NYC area.

While we do not have any in-office attendance requirements, we prefer hiring people within commuting distance of our NYC office because we value getting together in person regularly. For those who enjoy working from our Manhattan office on a more regular basis, we offer catered lunches, and happy hours, among other fun perks.
NAME: Digital Designer
TAGS: Administrative Services, HR and Recruiting, Internet Services, Software, 1 - 10, Seed,

DESCRIPTION:
Company Description
Hulugram is an innovative tech company offering a multi-purpose messaging, social media, and ecommerce app. Our platform integrates a wide array of features including text and voice messaging, shopping, social networking, and financial transactions, all within a single, user-friendly interface.
Role Overview
We are on the lookout for an experienced Mobile Application Developer, skilled in Native Java and Flutter, to join our dynamic team. With your expertise, you will play a crucial role in enhancing and expanding our app's capabilities, ensuring a seamless and engaging user experience. As part of our team, you will collaborate closely with cross-functional groups, contributing significantly to the app's continual development and success.
Key Responsibilities
  • Design and build advanced applications for the Android platform using Native Java and Flutter.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define, design, and ship new features.
  • Ensure the performance, quality, and responsiveness of applications.
  • Identify and correct bottlenecks and fix bugs.
  • Help maintain code quality, organization, and automatization.
  • Stay up-to-date with new technology trends, applications, and protocols in the mobile development world.

Requirements
  • Minimum of 3+ years of proven experience in Android app development
  • .Strong knowledge of Android SDK, different versions of Android, and how to deal with different screen sizes
  • .Familiarity with RESTful APIs to connect Android applications to back-end services
  • .Proficient understanding of code versioning tools, such as Git
  • .Experience with Android UI principles and best practices
  • .Knowledge of the open-source Android ecosystem and the libraries available for common tasks
  • .Ability to understand business requirements and translate them into technical requirements
.
Preferred Qualification
  • s
  • Published one or more Android apps in the Google Play Stor
  • e.Experience with Flutter and cross-platform mobile app developmen
  • t.Strong understanding of the full mobile development life cycl
  • e.Experience with cloud message APIs and push notification
s.
Benefi
  • ts
  • Competitive salary with bonus potenti
  • al.Flexible work polici
  • es.Opportunities for professional development and career grow
th.
How to Apply
Please submit your resume, along with a portfolio of your work (links to live projects preferred), and a cover letter explaining why you would be a great fit for this role and Hulugram.
NAME: UI/UX and Graphics Designer
TAGS: Community and Lifestyle, Mobile, Platforms, and Apps, Software, 1 - 10, Pre Seed,

DESCRIPTION:
Who we are
We’re a fast-moving, diverse team pushing the frontiers of artificial intelligence. At Twelve Labs, our mission is to help developers build programs that can see, listen, and understand the world as we do by bringing the world’s most powerful video understanding infrastructure to market. As a part of achieving this mission, we are building foundation AI models that can accurately and instantly search exact moments within petabytes of video archives, generate coherent text summaries of videos, perform prompt-based video generation, and many more. The Twelve Labs platform provides access to its Large Visual Language Models (VLMs) through a suite of APIs that are trained on massive video datasets and learn to understand the meaning and context behind the visuals, conversations, and sounds within videos.
Twelve Labs recently raised $17M in seed funding, recognized as one of CB Insights’ AI 100 companies within a year of its founding, and secured a massive compute resource through partnering with Oracle. We are hyper focused on delivering the Twelve Labs platform to our customers so they can build video understanding into their products and power dream features they could have only imagined.
Part of the pathway to our rapid growth has been paved by the outstanding group of people united by the company’s mission. Beyond prominent venture capital firms such as Index Ventures and Radical Ventures, the Twelve Labs mission is backed by category building luminaries like Fei-Fei Li (Stanford HAI), Silvio Savarese (Salesforce), Oren Etzioni (AI2), Alexandr Wang (Scale), Lukas Biewald (W&B), Jack Conte (Patreon) and more.
We are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive work environment where our team members can bring their full selves to work, bring out their potential, and most importantly, thrive together. We welcome kind, brilliant, and open minded people from all walks of life to our team. If joining this mission speaks to you, we encourage you to apply!
About the role:
Twelve Labs is at the forefront of pioneering video AI technology, transforming the realm of video interaction with our groundbreaking multimodal video foundation model. Our Product Development Team is dedicated to crafting these sophisticated AI models into user-friendly and powerful APIs, revolutionizing video search and generative tasks.
As our Lead Product Designer, you will be entrusted with the task of creating a seamless and engaging user experience for our Video Understanding Platform. This role is not just about designing interfaces; it's about architecting a cohesive ecosystem comprising the Playground, Dashboard, API, partner integrations, upcoming SDKs, and more, that are integral to our users and developer community. Collaborating with our cross-disciplinary teams, including ML Research, Engineering, and Go-to-Market (GTM), you will play a critical role in making our AI technology more accessible and impactful.
This role is for those with a passion for product design in fast-paced tech environments. Your expertise in understanding user needs through both qualitative and quantitative lenses, coupled with your agility in devising creative strategies, will be key in continually evolving our products.

You will:

  • Spearhead the product design vision, defining the overarching vision and making pivotal decisions
  • Take charge of design work across full cycle product development from concept, research to design, development, launch and post-launch
  • Closely collaborate with internal teams such as Product Management, Engineering, Go-to-Market, Research, and Data Science. This collaborative effort aims to shape strategic decisions and metrics, ultimately optimizing the user experience for maximum impact.
  • Ensure a cohesive and unified user experience by developing and upholding design systems and standards for Twelve Labs platform
  • Collaborate seamlessly with the Growth team to encapsulate the brand and product ethos within the visual identity and the overarching design philosophy reflected on the website.

Requirements:

  • Minimum 7 years of experience in SaaS product design, with a preference for those who have led projects or teams. Candidates must submit a portfolio.
  • Experience designing 0-1 innovative products that are not yet in the market.
  • Proficient in handling complex information, technology, and policies to create structured and consistent user interfaces.
  • Proven track record in designing products for enterprise or developer-focused audiences.
  • Solid experience in user research, usability testing, user-centered design methodologies, and analyzing user data to extract actionable insights.
  • Exceptional communication skills, fostering collaboration across various teams.

Desirable Qualities:

  • Strong interest in AI and machine learning concepts and their application in product design.
  • Experience in designing AI-powered applications or platforms.
  • Previous experience working in a startup environment is a plus.
Interview and Onboarding Process
Resume + Portfolio → Recruiter Phone Screen -> Hiring Manager Call -> Portfolio presentation → Technical Interview and/or Take Home Assignment -> Culture Interview -> Reference Checks
Even If there are a few checkboxes that aren’t ticked through your prior experience, we still encourage you to apply! If you are a 0-to-1 achiever, a ferocious learner, and a kind and fun team player who motivates others, you will find a home at Twelve Labs.
We welcome applicants from all walks of life and are committed to equal opportunity employment. We cherish and celebrate diversity not just because it is the right thing to do, but because it makes our company much stronger.
Benefits and Perks
🤝 An open and inclusive culture and work environment.
🧑‍💻 Work closely with a collaborative, mission-driven team on cutting-edge AI technology.
🦷 Full health, dental, and vision benefits
✈️ Extremely flexible PTO and parental leave policy. Office closed the week of Christmas and New Years.
🏙 Remote-flexible, offices in San Francisco and Seoul and coworking stipend
🛂 VISA support (such as H1B and OPT transfer for US employees)
NAME: Lead Product Designer
TAGS: Media, Software, 11 - 50, Seed,

DESCRIPTION:
At Preply, we are unlocking human potential through learning.

We believe learning with a great tutor is life-changing. That’s why we match online tutors from across the globe with learners and empower them to create live language classes with AI-powered tools and learning materials. This is how we deliver progress, create engagement and keep our global community of learners motivated. So far, over 32,000 tutors have given more than 15 million lessons to learners from over 175 countries.

Meet the team!

In Corporate IT, we're dedicated to elevating Preply's internal infrastructure, empowering users for peak productivity. We bring flair to the workplace, ensuring a seamless blend of efficient tools and style!

What you’ll be doing:

  • Lead IT operations and user support, including access management, device management, onboarding and offboarding processes, etc.
  • Automation: Offering guidance and support for streamlining routine tasks, promoting a more efficient workload, and enhancing scalability with ease.
  • Testing and evaluating new technologies.
  • Create and uphold comprehensive documentation for supported applications, processes, and training materials, fostering a resourceful repository for both internal employees and IT staff.
  • Help maintain and improve our cloud infrastructure (Okta & Jamf).
  • Lead and collaborate on Corporate IT projects and goals.
  • Engage in collaborative efforts to define and track Objectives and Key Results (OKRs), fostering alignment and shared achievement.
  • Work closely with the team to enhance end-user support, ensuring a collaborative and efficient approach to addressing user needs.

What you need to succeed:

  • 5 years of experience within a similar scope
  • Experience working with cloud infrastructure tools for corporate use (Okta, Jamf etc.)
  • Demonstrate robust automation skills, showcasing expertise in identifying, planning, and seamlessly implementing automation within our systems to enhance scalability.
  • Coding experience in languages like Bash, Python or Powershell
  • Proven expertise in effectively managing relationships with senior stakeholders.
  • Able to work autonomously while taking ownership of projects
  • Strong communication skills in English (our team features more than 25 nationalities)
  • The ability to focus on what counts, creating simple solutions to deliver fast results
  • A passion for learning and a desire for self-improvement

Why you’ll love it at Preply

  • An open, collaborative, dynamic and diverse culture;
  • A generous monthly allowance for lessons on Preply.com, Learning & Development budget and time off for your self-development;
  • A competitive financial package with equity, leave allowance and health insurance;
  • Access to free mental health support platforms;
  • Access to Gympass-partnered wellness and gym centers throughout Spain to promote and support well-being and physical health
  • The opportunity to unlock the potential of learners and tutors through language learning and teaching in 175 countries (and counting!).

Our Principles

  • Care to change the world - We are passionate about our work and care deeply about its impact to be life changing.
  • We do it for learners - For both Preply and tutors, learners are why we do what we do. Every day we focus on empowering tutors to deliver an exceptional learning experience.
  • Keep perfecting - To create an outstanding customer experience, we focus on simplicity, smoothness, and enjoyment, continually perfecting it as every detail matters.
  • Now is the time - In a fast-paced world, it matters how quickly we act. Now is the time to make great things happen.
  • Disciplined execution - What makes us disciplined is the excellence in our execution. We set clear goals, focus on what matters, and utilize our resources efficiently.
  • Dive deep - We leverage business acumen and curiosity to investigate disparities between numbers and stories, unlocking meaningful insights to guide our decisions.
  • Growth mindset - We proactively seek growth opportunities and believe today's best performance becomes tomorrow's starting point. We humbly embrace feedback and learn from setbacks.
  • Raise the bar - We raise our performance standards continuously, alongside each new hire and promotion. We build diverse and high-performing teams that can make a real difference.
  • Challenge, disagree and commit - We value open and candid communication, even when we don’t fully agree. We speak our minds, challenge when necessary, and fully commit to decisions once made.
  • One Preply - We prioritize collaboration, inclusion, and the success of our team over personal ambitions. Together, we support and celebrate each other's progress.

Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion

Preply is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment where people from all backgrounds can thrive. Different opinions and viewpoints are key ingredients in our success as a multicultural Ed-Tech company.

Preply will consider all applications for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, age or veteran status. Together, we are The World Class.
NAME: Senior Corporate IT Engineer
TAGS: Education, Software, 5001+, Series C+,

DESCRIPTION:
At Preply, we are unlocking human potential through learning.

We believe learning with a great tutor is life-changing. That’s why we match online tutors from across the globe with learners and empower them to create live language classes with AI-powered tools and learning materials. This is how we deliver progress, create engagement and keep our global community of learners motivated. So far, over 32,000 tutors have given more than 15 million lessons to learners from over 175 countries.

Meet the team!

As a Junior Financial Analyst, you will be part of the finance team and work closely with various stakeholders to analyze financial data, create reports, and provide insights that will drive informed decision-making within the organization. You will play a crucial role in supporting our financial planning and analysis efforts. This is an excellent opportunity for a highly motivated individual who is eager to develop their analytical skills and contribute to the growth of a dynamic tech scale-up.

What you’ll be doing:

  • Perform financial analysis and modeling to support strategic and operational decision-making processes.
  • Conduct variance analysis and identify trends, risks, and opportunities.
  • Prepare regular financial reports, dashboards, and presentations for management including key performance indicators (KPIs) and insights on financial performance.
  • Pursue cost management across the business, monitoring procurement requests and processes.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather relevant financial data and ensure accuracy.
  • Assist in budgeting, forecasting, and financial planning activities.
  • Support the preparation of financial statements, including income statements, balance sheets, and cash flow statements.

What you need to succeed:

  • Bachelors’ Degree in Finance, Economics, Business Administration or Business Management. It will be a plus having previous experience within similar responsibilities.
  • Strong communication skills. Minimum C1 level of English.
  • Motivated to join the Tech industry.
  • Comfortable working with large amounts of data and modern finance tools, SQL is a plus.
  • Willing to work on-site around 3 days weekly.

Why you’ll love it at Preply

  • An open, collaborative, dynamic and diverse culture;
  • A generous monthly allowance for lessons on Preply.com, Learning & Development budget and time off for your self-development;

  • Now is the time - In a fast-paced world, it matters how quickly we act. Now is the time to make great things happen.
  • Disciplined execution - What makes us disciplined is the excellence in our execution. We set clear goals, focus on what matters, and utilize our resources efficiently.
  • Dive deep - We leverage business acumen and curiosity to investigate disparities between numbers and stories, unlocking meaningful insights to guide our decisions.
  • Growth mindset - We proactively seek growth opportunities and believe today's best performance becomes tomorrow's starting point. We humbly embrace feedback and learn from setbacks.
  • Raise the bar - We raise our performance standards continuously, alongside each new hire and promotion. We build diverse and high-performing teams that can make a real difference.
  • Challenge, disagree and commit - We value open and candid communication, even when we don’t fully agree. We speak our minds, challenge when necessary, and fully commit to decisions once made.
  • One Preply - We prioritize collaboration, inclusion, and the success of our team over personal ambitions. Together, we support and celebrate each other's progress.

Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion

Preply is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment where people from all backgrounds can thrive. Different opinions and viewpoints are key ingredients in our success as a multicultural Ed-Tech company.

NAME: Junior Financial Analyst
TAGS: Education, Software, 5001+, Series C+,

DESCRIPTION:
What’s Bench? Visit Bench's latest news to see what's happening, and read what our customers have to say. You can also check us out in Medium, on our LinkedIn page, our Instagram, and our Life at Bench Blog.

We acknowledge that Bench is founded on the traditional, ancestral, and unceded territory of the Coast Salish Peoples, including the territories of the xʷməθkwəy̓əm (Musqueam), Skwxwú7mesh (Squamish), and Səl̓ílwətaʔ/Selilwitulh (Tsleil-Waututh) Nations.

Businesses need to understand their financial performance, but for many smaller ones, this means a trade-off between managing their books and running their businesses.

Our mission is to help every business owner thrive, by providing financial insight and peace of mind in one seamless platform. From creatives to chiropractors, Bench helps thousands of small business owners and entrepreneurs master their financial lives. Because understanding your finances should be three things: simple, effortless, and affordable.

We’re growing fast, and we’re looking for exceptional people to join us on this incredible journey. Check out our culture guide to learn more about what it’s like to work at Bench and read more about our business here!

What does the Finance department look like?

We’re a close-knit team of scrappy, driven folks that are committed to making sure Bench has what it needs to succeed. From accounting, treasury and legal, to strategy, financial planning and analysis, we have a broad portfolio that lets us engage with every part of the business. We enjoy solving problems together through open communication and collaboration, while respecting each other’s ideas.

Bench’s Finance team builds and maintains the systems and processes that enables Bench to operate efficiently day-to-day, as well as provide key financial data that helps drive Bench’s success and growth. Being a member of this team means you’ll play an integral role in increasing the efficiency and efficacy of our month end close, financial reporting, procurement and day to day operations. We’ve done some of the heavy lifting already, but, there is still a lot to build and scale.

Reporting to our Finance Manager, you will have the opportunity to hone and apply your existing accounting, structured problem-solving and process development skills into everything that we do. You’ll be a key contributor from day one, and you’ll learn all the in’s and outs of how a finance team at a tech company operates.

What you’ll get up to:

  • Ownership of the Order to cash process (Revenue cycle)
  • Develop and update accounting policies and procedures for revenue recognition in accordance with US GAAP
  • Analyze billing information from various data sources and use it to report revenue on a timely and accurate basis
  • Conduct detailed variance analysis of revenue and receivables on a monthly/quarterly/annual basis vs budget and vs prior period(s).
  • Assist FP&A in revenue forecasting and the impact of different variables on sales and revenue recognition, including the impact of seasonal factors.
  • As the subject matter expert on Revenue accounting and reporting, be responsible for advising the business on the impact on reporting due to changes in product, practices, pricing, and strategy. Be the point of contact to address all queries related to revenue recognition.
  • Produce the data required for timely and accurate sales tax filings, while developing process efficiencies and automations.
  • Develop and automate the production of a single sales dashboard to be used by business stakeholders.
  • Lead automation projects, working with business and IT teams, to reduce reporting time and improve efficiency and accuracy in all related deliverables.
  • Own the Accounts Receivable function to ensure cash is received timely and receivable balances and analysis are accurately reported.
  • Work with the Partnerships teams to manage Partnerships, agreements, invoicing and receivables from onboarding and review of agreements to invoicing and recovery of dues.
  • Lead the financial audit for Revenue/Receivable line items and assist in other areas as required.
  • Assist the Manager of Financial reporting in performing reconciliation as required.
  • Provide leadership to other team members by teaching and working with them to tackle complex technical and operational problems.
  • Assist with any other accounting/reporting requirements

What you'll need:

  • 4+ years in a similar role
  • Working knowledge of US GAAP, and ASC 606
  • CPA would be an asset
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint, and Google Sheets
  • Working knowledge of Stripe and NetSuite, and SQL is an asset
  • Experience in a SaaS based company is preferred
  • Superior organization and prioritization skills, keen attention to detail
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Able to work under pressure in a tight deadline-oriented environment
  • Willingness to work overtime as required during peak closing periods, and audit time

What you'll get:

  • At Bench we share information freely and openly whenever possible. The salary range for this role is $73,200 - $91,500 per year, depending on experience.
  • In addition, we offer an extended benefits package that includes paid vacation, paid flex days, stock options, and full health, dental, and vision.
  • You’ll get access to Inkblot Therapy’s Employee and Family Assistance Program (EAP) that offers counseling and support, for you and family members, as well as professional development coaching, financial advice, legal advice and much more.
  • Bench has a number of Affinity Groups - groups of people who have shared identities and experiences! The purpose of these groups is to support underrepresented Benchmates and amplify their voices.
  • If you live in BC’s Lower Mainland, you have the opportunity to work at home and in our downtown office location, depending on your preference! For some roles, we do require folks to be in the office regularly. We’ll be sure to outline expectations during the interview process.
  • For folks working fully remote, we will provide additional solutions to bring teams together for collaboration and connection.
  • Whether you get to use the office or if you work remotely, you’ll have access to our Home Office Setup Fund to ensure that you have everything you need to work comfortably from home, from day one.
  • You’ll have the opportunity to work from somewhere other than your home province for up to 3 months, within a 12 month period.

Everyone has their own unique talents. Even if you don’t meet 100% of the qualifications outlined above, tell us why you’d be a great fit for this role in your application.

We believe that unchecked biases disproportionately impact the most marginalized people in society—including but not limited to BIPOC, LGBTQ2S+ people, immigrants, and people with disabilities. We strongly encourage applications from people with these identities or other marginalized communities because we believe that without you, we are all less. If you are selected for an interview and require support during the process, including disability accommodation, we'll give you the opportunity to tell us when we contact you.
NAME: Revenue Analyst
TAGS: Finance, Professional Services, 201 - 1000, Series C+,

DESCRIPTION:
What’s Bench? Check us out in Medium, Betakit, Financial Post, Fintech Impact, Perkins + Will, BC Business, our Instagram, and our Blog.

We acknowledge that Bench headquarters is located on the traditional, ancestral, and unceded territory of the Coast Salish Peoples, including the territories of the xʷməθkwəy̓əm (Musqueam), Skwxwú7mesh (Squamish), and Səl̓ílwətaʔ/Selilwitulh (Tsleil-Waututh) Nations.

Our mission is to make a profound difference in the quality of life of one million people, by removing the financial complexity of entrepreneurship. Businesses need to understand their financial performance, but for many smaller ones, this means a trade-off between doing their books and running their businesses.

Bench solves this dilemma by taking bookkeeping off of their hands. Learn more about us on our About page.

We’re growing fast, and we’re looking for exceptional people to join us on this incredible journey. Check out our culture guide to learn more about what it’s like to work at Bench!

What does the Data team look like?

At Bench, the Data team encompasses the full gamut of business intelligence and data analytics activities. We are responsible for creating and maintaining the infrastructure that gets analysts and leadership across the company the information they need. We do this by developing and maintaining data pipelines, a data warehouse, and visualization tools, and by leading the adoption of new technology and practices to improve the lives of our data consumers. We also ensure that our data infrastructure is fit-for-purpose by using it ourselves as analysts for our Product team, and by filling any gaps in reporting and analysis that aren’t covered by analysts elsewhere in the company.

What you’ll get up to:

  • Listen to requests from analysts or business partners, deeply understand their needs, and translate those needs into requirements for data products
  • Write analytic queries that transform raw data from source systems into business facts and metrics
  • Review queries, scripts, and visualizations produced by other analysts to ensure consistent accuracy and quality
  • Apply software engineering best practices like version control and continuous integration to the analytics code base.
  • Produce presentations, dashboards, and self-service tools to make data accessible to and understandable by everyone at Bench
  • Participate in planning and prioritization of work to be done by the Data team
  • Protect our clients and colleagues by maintaining security and access control over our data
  • Learn about emerging or established data technologies and evaluate whether Bench can benefit from their adoption

Must haves:

  • SQL expertise: Writing, debugging, and reviewing queries that make heavy use of analytics functionality (complex aggregations, window functions, common table expressions) and that operate on many rows of data is a daily occurrence in this role.
  • Data visualization and storytelling: We create value when the things we build are being used. For us, that means translating data into useful insights using a BI tool (eg. Tableau, Power BI), or even an effective graph or dashboard in Excel/Google Sheets.
  • Cloud Services: Experience with cloud services used in data analytics, ideally AWS (eg. Redshift, Glue, DMS, Lambda), will enable you to operate at every stage of our data pipeline.
  • Proficiency with version control systems: We source-control our analytics code to ensure that metrics are consistent, no matter who pulls the data. Experience using the feature branch Git workflow model will help you understand how logic gets “promoted to production”.
  • Technical written and verbal communication: From going deep on technical details with fellow analysts, to explaining results to business partners, to forming recommendations for senior leadership, you possess effective written and verbal communication skills at a wide range of complexity and detail.
  • Responsibility and leadership: Our success depends on taking ownership and building trust - both among teammates and with stakeholders. To maintain that trust, we expect each other to make commitments, to keep those commitments, and to hold ourselves to account for those commitments.
  • Curiosity, mentorship and a drive to learn: We become better analysts and technologists through continuous learning and by teaching others what we know. Fostering growth is what we do here, in ourselves and in our colleagues. You are as committed to your own growth as that of your team.

Nice to haves:

  • Exposure to workflow orchestration tools (eg. Airflow, Prefect, Luigi)
  • Experience with dbt Core / Cloud
  • Familiarity with Agile/Scrum methodologies
  • Previous experience in SaaS growth, product, or marketing analytics
  • Experience with functional scripting languages (e.g. Python, R, JS)

What you'll get:

  • At Bench we share information freely and openly whenever possible. The salary range for this role is $109,680 - $137,100 per year, depending on experience.
  • In addition, we offer an extended benefits package that includes paid vacation, paid flex days, stock options and full health, dental, and vision.
  • You’ll get access to Inkblot Therapy’s Employee and Family Assistance Program (EAP) that offers counseling and support, for you and family members, as well as professional development coaching, financial advice, legal advice and much more.
  • Bench has a number of Affinity Groups - groups of people who have shared identities and experiences! The purpose of these groups is to support underrepresented Benchmates and amplify their voices.
  • If you live in BC’s Lower Mainland, you have the opportunity to work at home and in our downtown office location, depending on your preference!
  • For folks working fully remote, we will provide additional solutions to bring teams together for collaboration and connection.
  • Whether you get to use the office or if you work remotely, you’ll have access to our Home Office Setup Fund to ensure that you have everything you need to work comfortably from home, from day one.
  • You’ll have the opportunity to work from somewhere other than your home province for up to 3 months, within a 12 month period.

Everyone has their own unique talents. Even if you don’t meet 100% of the qualifications outlined above, tell us why you’d be a great fit for this role in your application.

We believe that unchecked biases disproportionately impact the most marginalized people in society—including but not limited to BIPOC, LGBTQ2S+ people, immigrants, and people with disabilities. We strongly encourage applications from people with these identities or other marginalized communities because we believe that without you, we are all less. If you are selected for an interview and require support during the process, including disability accommodation, we'll give you the opportunity to tell us when we contact you.
NAME: Data Architect
TAGS: Finance, Professional Services, 201 - 1000, Series C+,

DESCRIPTION:
역할 및 책임

  • 사용자 관점에 입각한 웹사이트 디자인을 통해 사용자 경험을 향상
  • 센드버드 브랜드에 기반한 디자인 솔루션 및 비주얼 개발

핵심 자격요건

  • 4년 이상 해당 업무 경력이 있으신 분
  • Figma 툴 사용에 능숙하신 분
  • BX 및 UX/UI 관련 유관부서와의 협업을 통한 문제 해결 능력이 있으신 분
  • B2B 서비스에 대한 이해도를 바탕으로 한 디자인 능력을 보유하신 분
  • Web UI에 대한 높은 이해도를 가지고 있으신 분
  • Web UI, 제품 목업에 필요한 Asset 개선 및 제작 경험이 있으신 분
  • 서류 전형 접수해 주실 때 디자인 포트폴리오 제출은 필수입니다.

우대 사항

  • 비즈니스 협업을 위한 영어 능력
  • 제품의 특성을 다양한 비주얼 형태로 표현이 가능하신 분(ex. Motion, 3D)

디자인 직군 전문 장비 제공

  • 전문가용 고성능 Macbook Pro 16인치
  • LG UltraFine 5K 모니터

센드버드만의 특별한 복지를 소개해요

  • 1년뒤부터 행사가능한 실리콘밸리 최고 수준의 스톡옵션
  • 하이브리드 근무제, 유연근무제
  • 플레이스테이션, 자전거, 여행 등 자유롭게 사용할 수 있는 현금성 연간 복지포인트 약 400만원
  • 모션데스크, 의자, 모니터, 에어팟 등의 재택 근무 물품 지원 약 100만원 상당
  • 영어회화, 강의 등 자유롭게 수강할 수 있는 어학 지원금 최대 연간 360만원
  • 매주 1회 오피스 런치 지원
  • 매월 1회 팀 빌딩 비용 지원
  • 출퇴근 비용(교통비) 일부 지원
  • 선릉 오피스 주차 무료
  • 본인, 배우자, 자녀 모두 포함하는 단체보험 지원
  • MRI, 유전자검사등을 포함한 1인당 40만원 상당의 건강검진 지원 - 본인 및 가족 1인
  • 법정 연차 외 7개의 휴가 추가 지급 (Boost leave, Birthday leave, etc)
  • 맥북 프로 등 최신 업무 기기 지원 (직무별 특별 지원 옵션)
  • 스낵, 음료수, 라면이 매일 가득 채워지는 무제한 스낵바
  • 12주 유급 출산 휴가 지원 (엄마, 아빠 모두가능)
  • 기타 경조사 지원 프로그램 등

그 외 다양한 이벤트와 선물: 온라인 요가, 케어패키지, 센드버디안 알아가기 20 Questions, Global Step Challenge, 퀴즈쇼 등 사람 냄새 나는 다양한 이벤트를 하고 있습니다. 센드버드만의 특별한 복지는 계속해서 발전하고 있습니다.

The Future of Work at Sendbird

센드버드는 업무 효율성과 팀간의 협업 및 관계형성에 모두 중요한 가치를 두고 있습니다. 그 취지로 새로워진 Future of work 제도를 운영합니다. 최적의 근무 장소와 시간을 자율적으로 선택하면서도, 함께 일하는 시너지를 얻기 위해 출근 거리 1시간 이내에 거주하시는 분들은 주 2회 오피스로 출근하게 됩니다. 본인의 거주지, 근무하게 될 조직이나 업무 성격에 따라 출근 빈도는 팀과 상의하여 정합니다.

센드버드가 생각하는 다양성과 포용

위 요구사항에 100% 부합하지 않으셔도 괜찮습니다. 센드버드는 모두가 배우고 성장할 수 있는 곳이기에 다양한 배경, 경험 및 기술 스택을 가진 누구든 최고의 직원이 되실 수 있다고 생각합니다. 우리는 평등한 고용 기회를 위해 다양성을 존중하고 장려하고 있습니다. 이 포지션이 여러분의 가슴을 뛰게 만든다면 지원해주세요!

NAME: Staff Product Designer, Automate
TAGS: Administrative Services, Commerce and Shopping, Consumer Products, Hardware, Professional Services, Software, 201 - 1000, Series C+,

DESCRIPTION:
Media Analyst

Do you want to be part of the most disruptive & acclaimed startups in sustainability? Do you also believe in the power of knowledge to shape a better world? Achieve a real impact by joining Illuminem’s Content Curation team! Welcome onboard!

About us & our vision

illuminem is the leading source of sustainability information and data. Over 1200 global experts (from climate ministers to international CEOs) make illuminem the world’s largest network in sustainability. It has been recently awarded as one of TechStar's 12 Sustainability Startups globally, AngelList’s ‘Top Digital Startups' in Europe and Startup Italia’s ‘Leading Innovator in Italy’. Together, we will launch a platform bringing radical transparency to corporate ESG action. Visit https://illuminem.com/

What will you do?

  • Shape Our Platform: Contribute to providing comprehensive sustainability information coverage by regularly posting sustainability news and writing summaries for our ‘illuminem Briefings’
  • Be a part of our ‘illuminem Voices’ Section: Engage with the best energy & sustainability professionals, experts and activists in relevant fields. Foster their involvement in our projects, enriching our content with insights and articles
  • Empower our Newsletters: Create, curate, and analyze the performance of our newsletters, delivering cutting-edge sustainability & energy insights, and focusing on increasing our subscriber engagement and base
  • Understand What Matters: Identify the key trends of the sector to guarantee top-notch content quality for our readers
  • Participate in the Team: Join our dynamic team and make an impact across a spectrum of roles, from Content Curation to illuminem Voices. Your adaptability and willingness to assist in various capacities will be highly appreciated

What are we looking for?

  • Reliability: Immediately assume key responsibilities from Day 1, evidencing your dependability and capability in essential roles
  • Flexibility: Lead actions across various fronts, from daily and recurrent operations to strategic projects
  • A Passion for the Challenge: How will you take Illuminem to 100,000 readers?
  • Educational Qualifications: You are currently pursuing your Bachelor’s / Master's degree or have recently graduated in a business or media-related subject from a top university
  • Sustainability Knowledge: Demonstrate a deep understanding and passion for sustainability in your professional approach
  • Excellent verbal & written English skills: Clearly and concisely communicate, distilling insights from documents and discussions with proficiency
  • Willingness to be co-located in our Venice HQ (accommodation provided)
  • Legal Work Eligibility in Italy: Hold a valid EU Working Permit in order to proceed for this position

Why should you apply?

  • Have a story you will tell for life: Be part of the success of a high-potential venture from its launch
  • Join a valued network: Join a team composed of top professionals and advised by C-level executives, gaining access to unparalleled networking, career & mentoring opportunities
  • Invest in yourself, not only on your CV: Learn how to launch a successful business not by reading a biography but by taking the challenge, turning everyday problems into solutions
  • Work for a company worth your name: Do not compromise on your ideals, but be proud every day to achieve impact for a big cause, and simply work in an environment grounded in its values

Apply here on LinkedIn or through:

https://illuminem.com/contact

We at http://illuminem.com value a diverse workforce and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. We encourage applications from individuals of all backgrounds, and are looking forward to welcoming the right person to our team.
NAME: Media Analyst
TAGS: Content and Publishing, Energy, Media, Sustainability, 51 - 200,

DESCRIPTION:
In the minute it takes you to read this job description, Bluecore has launched over 100,000 individually personalized marketing campaigns for our retail ecommerce customers!

The DataOps team empowers Bluecore’s customers and internal teams to win with data. We do that through analytics products, client-facing reporting & exports, and internal BI. These are built on solid analytics engineering and data quality management.

We’re seeking an experienced analyst to help drive Bluecore’s impact at some of the world’s largest retailers.

In this role, you’ll design KPIs for new products & initiatives, working closely with Bluecore’s Product & Strategy teams. You’ll bring clarity to Bluecore’s clients through thoughtful metric design, intuitive visualization and original insights & case studies. You’ll develop new market-facing data/analytics products like ecommerce industry benchmarks.

We’re looking for someone who is excited to be a leader in Bluecore’s data driven culture, has deep technical chops, and is passionate about building great data products. The right person for this role thrives working with senior leaders to define & build a high-impact analytics roadmap.

Responsibilities

  • Design metrics and reporting to quantify Bluecore’s value to our clients, especially around ecomm metrics in identification and shopper engagement.
  • Develop benchmarks & other metrics used in thought leadership reports, in partnership with our Marketing team.
  • Translate needs from business and product stakeholders to analytics outputs; collaborate with our analytics engineers to design underlying data warehouse models.
  • Utilize SQL & Python (in Hex) to build new analyses and expand existing ones.
  • Enable Product & business teams to use data to support our customers through data app development, user training/onboarding, and documentation.
  • Support scale-out of an accurate and comprehensive single source of truth through rigorous metric design & analysis, excellent communications & documentation, and adherence to data ops best practices.
  • Actively communicate findings to stakeholders across the org, including Product, GTM and Engineering.

The DataOps team empowers Bluecore’s customers and internal teams to win with data. We do that through analytics products, client-facing reporting & exports, and internal BI. These are built on solid analytics engineering and data quality management.

We’re seeking an experienced analyst to help drive Bluecore’s impact at some of the world’s largest retailers.

In this role, you’ll design KPIs for new products & initiatives, working closely with Bluecore’s Product & Strategy teams. You’ll bring clarity to Bluecore’s clients through thoughtful metric design, intuitive visualization and original insights & case studies. You’ll develop new market-facing data/analytics products like ecommerce industry benchmarks.

We’re looking for someone who is excited to be a leader in Bluecore’s data driven culture, has deep technical chops, and is passionate about building great data products. The right person for this role thrives working with senior leaders to define & build a high-impact analytics roadmap.

Responsibilities

  • Design metrics and reporting to quantify Bluecore’s value to our clients, especially around ecomm metrics in identification and shopper engagement.
  • Develop benchmarks & other metrics used in thought leadership reports, in partnership with our Marketing team.
  • Translate needs from business and product stakeholders to analytics outputs; collaborate with our analytics engineers to design underlying data warehouse models.
  • Utilize SQL & Python (in Hex) to build new analyses and expand existing ones.
  • Enable Product & business teams to use data to support our customers through data app development, user training/onboarding, and documentation.
  • Support scale-out of an accurate and comprehensive single source of truth through rigorous metric design & analysis, excellent communications & documentation, and adherence to data ops best practices.
  • Actively communicate findings to stakeholders across the org, including Product, GTM and Engineering.

Qualifications

  • Clear and direct communication skills about complex, analytical/technical topics, including excellent data storytelling & visualization
  • Experience designing and reporting on metrics in retail analytics, ecommerce and/or digital marketing strongly preferred
  • Experience scoping & developing client-facing, production analytics products (data apps, reporting/analytics UI, export models), partnering with PMs and business counterparts
  • 5+ years experience in a data analyst, data science, product analytics, or business intelligence role
  • Experience with dbt, GitHub/code reviews, and data ops best practices strongly preferred.
  • 3+ years experience with Jupyter Notebooks or Hex
  • 3+ years working in SQL, including advanced functions
  • 2+ years of regular work in Python, including popular packages
  • Experience working with analytics engineers / data engineers to design data requirements for analytics use cases preferred
  • Experience using a dimensional data warehouse (i.e., fact, dimension & mart models) to derive insights & create standardized reporting

Tools in our stack

  • Hex
  • BigQuery
  • dbt
  • Looker
  • Fivetran
  • Metaplane
  • Hightouch
Salary Range:
$115,000 - $135,000 base salary

Our salary ranges are based on paying competitively for our size and industry. Salary is just one part of our total compensation package that includes equity, perks & benefits, and development opportunities at Bluecore. Individual pay decisions are based on several factors, including qualifications for the role, experience level, skillset, geography, and balancing internal equity relative to other Bluecorians. We expect that the majority of candidates who are offered roles at Bluecore to land well within our salary ranges based on these factors.

More About Us:

Bluecore is a multi-channel personalization platform that gives retailers a competitive advantage in a digital-first world. Unlike systems built for mass marketing and a physical-first world, Bluecore unifies shopper and product data in a single platform, and using easy-to-deploy predictive models, activates welcomed one-to-one experiences at the speed and scale of digital. Through Bluecore’s dynamic shopper and product matching, brands can personalize 100% of communications delivered to consumers through their shopping experiences, anywhere.

This comes to life in three core product lines:

  • Bluecore Communicate™ a modern email service provider (ESP) + SMS
  • Bluecore Site™ an onsite capture and personalization product
  • Bluecore Advertise™ a paid media product

Bluecore is credited with increasing lifetime value of shoppers and overall speed to marketing for more than 400 brands, including Express, Tommy Hilfiger, The North Face, Teleflora and Bass Pro Shops. We have been recognized as one of the Best Places to Work by Fortune, Crain's, Forbes and BuiltIn as well as ranked on the Inc. 5000, the most prestigious ranking of the nation’s fastest-growing private companies.

We are proud of the culture of flexibility, inclusivity and trust that we have built around our workforce. We are a remote first organization with the option to potentially work in our New York headquarters on occasion moving forward. We love the opportunity to come together – but employees will always have the option on where they work best.
At Bluecore we believe in encouraging an inclusive environment in which employees feel encouraged to share their unique perspectives, demonstrate their strengths, and act authentically. We know that diverse teams are strong teams, and welcome those from all backgrounds and varying experiences. Bluecore is a proud equal opportunity employer. We are committed to fair hiring practices and to building a welcoming environment for all team members. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, age, familial status or veteran status.
We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

NAME: Senior Intelligence Analyst
TAGS: Data and Analytics, DeepTech, Sales and Marketing, Security, Software, 11 - 50,

DESCRIPTION:
Sendbird has an exciting opportunity to join our company in the role of Solution Architect.

The Sendbird Solution Architect acts as a technical and product advisor to current customers and prospective clients. This role is responsible for architecting solutions with Sendbird services which meet customer demands while applying Sendbird best practices. Our Solutions Architects are involved in both pre sales as well as post sales activities. In this role, you will collaborate across sales, customer success and product groups to deliver innovative, flexible, and scalable solutions to our customers - some of the most notable brands in the world. The ideal candidate should be comfortable speaking with developers, product managers and C-level executives in the customers’ organization. You should have at
least two years of software engineering experience in front end, mobile or backend technologies. This role reports into the Solutions Architect Manager for the APAC region.

What you will do

  • Partner with Sales - You will partner with Account Executives to advise new prospects on Sendbird's product from a technical perspective as well as design tailored solutions that best fit the prospect's needs
  • Design and deliver presentations and demos - You will create customized presentations and demonstrations tailored to your audience. Preferably, you will have the ability to tell a compelling story that balances technical detail, features, and benefits in alignment to the customer's business goals
  • Work toward customer success - You will work with our Customer Success and Sales teams to educate customers on how to best use Sendbird
  • Lead technical implementation projects - You will own full implementation cycle responsibility for enterprise companies fro technical kick-off call to Go Live. You will also lead implementation design, consulting with customers on technical and UI design to architect efficient and scalable solutions
  • Build vertical solutions - You will build tools and vertical solutions with SendBird for customers as the need arises such as third-party integrations
  • Respond to security inquiries - Security is extremely important to Sendbird and our customers. You will help articulate our security story and lead security review responses. This includes speaking about conformance with security and compliance frameworks including HIPPA, SOC2, and ISO-27001
  • Contribute to RFP/RFI responses - You will work with and lead cross functional teams to prepare robust responses which help us win deals
  • Gather product feedback - Provide customer feedback to product teams and work together to close product feature gaps
  • Write technical resources - Write blog posts, tutorials, and documentation to make the adoption of SendBird more accessible to developers
  • Coordinate projects - Help manage projects with multiple stakeholders, both internal or external, to ensure timely and successful launches of SendBird integration
  • Become a domain expert - Follow the latest trends and features in the chat domain. Act as a trusted advisor for our customers when it comes to best practices for implementing chat

Who you are

  • Highly skilled at applying consultative methodologies and solving integration pain points while architecting features to answer business demands
  • Able to manage multiple projects running on parallel timelines and to work collaboratively in a globally distributed environment
  • Passionate about technology, customer service, and helping others
  • Creative thinker and experienced at understanding client's pain points
  • Excellent communicator both orally and written
  • Empathetic towards customer needs
  • Able to learn new technologies with an eye for good UX design
  • Able to travel, as necessary, to visit customers (up to 20% travel time)

What you bring to the table

  • BS in Information Systems, Engineering, or related field
  • 3+ years of hands-on implementation and Solutions Architect experience, OR 2+ years experience as a Solutions/Pre Sales architect, OR 2+ years professional experience as a full-stack engineer
  • Proven experience to read, debug, and understand web applications and complex systems
  • Detailed knowledge of HTTP methods for RESTful Services (Post, Get, Put, Delet)
  • Working knowledge of web integration including iframes, widgets, SDK, Single Sign On, APIs and other SaaS technologies
  • Programming experience with at least one programming language, such as JavaScript, Swift, Objective C, Java, Kotlin, or C#
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills including strong empathy for both customer needs and collaboration with cross functional teams
  • Experience in at least one web or mobile platform such as iOS, Android, React Native, React, or Angular
  • Debug and troubleshoot complex systems in web servers, applications, databases and mobile devices
  • Ability to guide a good UX design on customer’s chat implementation will be a plus

Helpful if you also have the following experiences

  • Familiarity with Salesforce Service Cloud or similar ticketing system
  • Frontend and backend software development experience
  • Active member of developer communities (Reddit, Stack Overflow, Hackernews, Stackshare)
  • In tune with overall industry and application trends

  • 영어회화, 강의 등 자유롭게 수강할 수 있는 어학 지원금 최대 연간 360만원

  • 본인, 배우자, 자녀 모두 포함하는 단체보험 지원
  • MRI, 유전자검사등을 포함한 1인당 40만원 상당의 건강검진 지원 - 본인 및 가족 1인
  • 법정 연차 외 7개의 휴가 추가 지급 (Boost leave, Birthday leave, etc)
  • 맥북 프로 등 최신 업무 기기 지원 (직무별 특별 지원 옵션)
  • 스낵, 음료수, 라면이 매일 가득 채워지는 무제한 스낵바
  • 12주 유급 출산 휴가 지원 (엄마, 아빠 모두가능)
  • 기타 경조사 지원 프로그램 등

The Future of Work at Sendbird

센드버드는 업무 효율성과 팀간의 협업 및 관계형성에 모두 중요한 가치를 두고 있습니다. 그 취지로 새로워진 Future of work 제도를 운영합니다. 최적의 근무 장소와 시간을 자율적으로 선택하면서도, 함께 일하는 시너지를 얻기 위해 출근 거리 1시간 이내에 거주하시는 분들은 주 2회 오피스로 출근하게 됩니다. 본인의 거주지, 근무하게 될 조직이나 업무 성격에 따라 출근 빈도는 팀과 상의하여 정합니다.

센드버드가 생각하는 다양성과 포용

위 요구사항에 100% 부합하지 않으셔도 괜찮습니다. 센드버드는 모두가 배우고 성장할 수 있는 곳이기에 다양한 배경, 경험 및 기술 스택을 가진 누구든 최고의 직원이 되실 수 있다고 생각합니다. 우리는 평등한 고용 기회를 위해 다양성을 존중하고 장려하고 있습니다. 이 포지션이 여러분의 가슴을 뛰게 만든다면 지원해주세요!

DESCRIPTION:
Context:

Developing renewable energy requires the ability to store its production and develop ways to stabilize the electrical grid. Stationary storage batteries have become affordable and they address these problems, but their operation is not so simple.

A battery has access to many sources of revenue, each with its own characteristics. Taken separately, no revenue can ensure long-term economic profitability on its own. Taken together, they guarantee stable revenues and rapid battery development.

We are developing trading and optimization algorithms to combine battery revenue sources and increase their lifespan. It is like an autopilot that defines in real time the actions that the battery must take on the markets.

About us:StackEase is a deeptech spinoff from INRIA (National Institute for Research in Computer Science and Automation). The startup was founded in August 2023 and has secured initial funding. Its members are located in Paris and Marseille.

Our values are innovation, merit, customer satisfaction, and sustainability. StackEase's raison d'être is to apply advances in machine learning to the energy transition.

Missions

  • Develop prediction tools for electricity market prices through supervised learning
  • Develop Reinforcement Learning based trading and optimisation algorithms for grid-scale battery profit optimisation
  • Develop automated unit tests and non regression tests
  • Validate and document results on real case scenarios
  • Participate in real-life test campaign
  • Support the algorithms deployment on the cloud

Preferred Skills

  • Enrolled in the last year of master degree of computer science, applied mathematics or electrical engineering
  • Excellent skills in mathematics, optimisation and computer science
  • Practical knowledge of supervised and reinforcement Learning
  • Enthusiastic, rigorous and autonomous, looking to discover entrepreneurship and the renewable energies
  • Fluent in English, proficient in French

Compensation

  • Paid internship
  • Partial home office possible, must come to the office every week

You do not need to meet 100% of the requirements to apply. References and a cover letter are welcome but not mandatory.

Expected start date : Flexible

Expected commitment : Full-time
